full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**

**Physical Security Upgrades at the Embassy of Canada to Peru**

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01014210
**Solicitation Number:** 23-225773
**Publication Date:** November 21, 2022
**Closing Date:** December 9, 2022

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is seeking a contractor to provide General Contractor Services for the planned security upgrades at the Canadian Embassy in Lima, Peru.

**Scope of Work:**

The project includes exterior security improvements and minor interior renovations, including:

* Anti-ram bollards
* Anti-pedestrian fencing
* Main guard house extension
* Electrical and mechanical services for the guard house
* Fire alarm system
* Perimeter lighting

**Project Requirements:**

The contractor must be capable of providing the full range of services required in English or French and have the ability to travel to Lima, Peru to commission the project. The contractor will be required to ensure excellent quality in multiple fields, including architecture, construction, and services.

**Eligibility Criteria:**

This tender is open to suppliers who are interested and capable of performing the work and have demonstrated that they meet the mandatory requirements for prequalification as described in Request for Qualification (RQ) 23-225773.

**Documents and Attachments:**

The tender documents and attachments can be found at [link to document]. Interested suppliers can request additional information by emailing realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca with the subject line NPP 23-225773.

**Timeline:**

The project timeline is as follows:

* Request for Proposal (RFP) - Stage 2: to be sent to qualified firms
* Submission of proposals: December 9, 2022
* Evaluation and selection: to be completed by dfatd
* Contract award: to be completed by dfatd

**Contact Information:**

For any inquiries or questions, please contact Brent Hygaard at realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca or 343-573-5242.

**Important Notes:**

Canada is not required to delay the solicitation or the award of any resulting contract. Canada is not responsible for reimbursing expenditures incurred by respondents responding to this tender.
The Minister will not reimbuse expenditures incurred by respondents responding to this NPP.
